title: sync errors when directories (and files?) exist with trailing dot between linux and windows
body:
when i create two directories on a linux machine:

* "directory a" 
* "directory a."

and let it sync with the sync client, the folders end up visible in the webgui. however, when i then configure the sync client on windows (tested on xp), one of them is removed. it's also removed on my linux machine then.

to reproduce:

* configure account and sync client on linux machine
* in file system: create 'directory a'
* in file system:  create 'directory a.'
* configure the account on windows as well and let it sync
* 'directory a.' is gone on windows.
* when you put stuff in 'directory a' on windows, it syncs it back to linux in 'directory a'
* 'directory a.' is now gone on linux as well.

when working in a shared archive, this has resulted in a big problem. our users store data per person, in directories like 'surname, a.' when syncing with windows, you actually get 'surname, a' with all the files in it, but when inspecting the webserver, it can be seen that the files are actually distributed over 'surname, a' and 'surname, a.'.

windows doesn't allow you to make dirs with a trailing dot, so that would be the problem.

i also suspect that's why we get sync errors, and the share is no longer syncable. however, i have yet to figure that out.

owncloud: 4.5.7
syncclient: 1.2.1
